themes.label: Decrees
themes.rationale: The text is a formal resolution passed by the council and the people, as indicated by the standard formulaic language of a decree.
themes.quote: δεδ χθαι το ς [συν] δροις κα τ[ ι δ μωι]

themes.label: Honorific Inscriptions
themes.rationale: The inscription honors the people of Kos and the specific judges sent to resolve legal disputes, granting them crowns and public praise.
themes.quote: ἐπαιν σαι τ ν δ μον [τ ν] κ ιων... ἐπαιν σαι δ [κ]α ρθαγ ρα[ν πποκρ του] τ μαρχον τιμ δα... κα στ[εφαν σαι καστον] [α τ] ν χρυσ στεφ ν[ωι]

themes.label: Agonistic / Victory Inscriptions
themes.rationale: The decree mentions that the honors should be announced during major festivals and gymnastic games.
themes.quote: ν το ς μεγ λαις σκλαπιε οις κα ωμα οις καθ κ στην παν γυριν ν το ς γυμνικο ς γ σιν

themes.label: Stele
themes.rationale: The text explicitly orders the decree to be inscribed on stone stelae.
themes.quote: ναγραφ δ κα ε ς στ λας τ δε τ ψ φισμα

themes.label: Marble
themes.rationale: Inscriptions of this nature found at the Asklepieion of Kos were typically carved on marble stelae.
themes.quote: νατεθ παρ α το ς μ ν ν τ ι πιφανεστ τ τ π τ ς γορ ς
themes.ambiguity_note: The material is not explicitly mentioned in the text but is inferred from the archaeological context of the findspot.

rationale: This inscription is a Hellenistic decree from the city of Chalcis (found in the Asklepieion of Kos) honoring Koan judges. The judges, Orthagoras and Timarchus, were sent from Kos to Chalcis to adjudicate legal cases. The text details their virtuous conduct and the honors bestowed upon them, including golden crowns and invitations to the Prytaneion. It also specifies that the honors be proclaimed at the Dionysia, Asklepieia, and Romaia festivals, and that the decree be published on stelae in the Agora and the Sanctuary of Asclepius.
